declarations.comments:
investigation of a Parser DSL that includes let bindings
that define 'variables' holding music sequences which can be placed
int the body of the score by using a 'call'
declarations.title: Binding

declarations.comments: Entry point - Parse a Euterpea DSL score.
declarations.title: parse

declarations.comments: where is this defined in Haskell Euterpea ?
declarations.title: eTime

declarations.comments:
I don't yet understand the original HSoM noteToMEvent shown here
this function sets MEvent charactersitics from the note pitch
together with the current context.  (The context has been set, for example,
by applying the phrase attributes).  However, when it comes to volume
it just ignores the context volume and replaces it with the context from
the note itself
perhaps it would be better if modifying the volume Phrase Attribute provided
a multiplier for the note volume and not simply a replacement
I need to review the original Euterpea documentation
declarations.title: noteToMEvent

children.comments:
A new type class to allow for musical polymorphism that ultimately
must be converted to Music1 to be converted to MIDI format through
the MEvent framework.
children.title: genericMode

declarations.comments:
We have difficulty with polymorphism in Music here
Euterpea uses a Tuple as the means of expressing
polymorphic values with the second element indicating the polymorphic value
However Purescript disallows type classes for Type Synonyms such as Tuples
Instead we use a data definition for Note1 which is not extensible polymorphically
declarations.title: Note1

declarations.comments: utility functions that should probably belong in various Purescript libraries
declarations.title: foldr1

declarations.comments:
how do I pattern match on Rationals?
how do I return an error?

declarations.comments:
Sometimes we may wish to alter the internal structure of a Music value
